alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, west central Owsley, northeastern Pulaski, southern Jackson, Rockcastle and central Clay Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mummie to Bandy. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... McKee, Maulden, Nathanton, Herd, Elian, Mummie, Zekes Point, Green Hall, Tyner and Privett around 635 PM EDT. Egypt, High Knob and Datha around 640 PM EDT. Sextons Creek, Sourwood, Chestnutburg, Malcomb, Shepherdtown and Sand Springs around 645 PM EDT. Sacker Gap, Burning Springs, Shopville and Hansford around 650 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Laurel Creek, Treadway, Bloss, Fall Rock, Pongo, Sidell, Manchester, Tanksley, Wild Cat, Mill Pond, Hensley, Bernice, Bent, Billows, Littleton and Hector. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
